definition: to place upside down/to invert/to pour/to throw out/to move backwards/however/actually/as a matter of fact/contrary to expectation
to fall/to collapse/to lie horizontally/to overthrow/to fail/to go bankrupt/to change (trains or buses)/to move around/to resell at a profit

sentences.english: Do whatever you want, but just don't be seen passing out or puking out of a taxi.
sentences.chinese: 做你想做的，但不要让人看见你昏倒或呕吐。

sentences.english: Tutti executed a fabulous fake faint, swooning cartoonishly right to the floor.
sentences.chinese: 图蒂假装晕倒，像卡通人物似的昏倒在地。

sentences.english: On a hot summer day an elderly gentleman faints in the street. A small
sentences.chinese: 在一个炎热的夏天，一位上了年纪的男子昏倒在街头。

sentences.english: Helen fainted but was brought to by the nurse.
sentences.chinese: 海伦昏倒了，但被护士救醒了。

sentences.english: The chairman was rushed to the hospital after collapsing with heart trouble.
sentences.chinese: 王先生因心脏病昏倒后，被急速送往医院。

sentences.english: Ding Yi faints and Xiu Ming sends him to the hospital.
sentences.chinese: 定一忽然昏倒，秀明送他到医疗室。

sentences.english: What do you do when you are about to faint physically?
sentences.chinese: 当你身体要昏倒的时候，你怎样作呢？

sentences.english: Heart not satisfying what parents are dead blow fainted in, was sent to the hospital.
sentences.chinese: 心怡禁受不住父母双亡的打击昏倒在地，被送进医院。

sentences.english: Several children fainted because of the heat.
sentences.chinese: 好几个孩子中署昏倒了。

sentences.english: The result, dog licking a bit of chicken ass, fox gas passed out.
sentences.chinese: 结果呢，小狗舔了一下鸡屁股，狐狸气昏倒了。

sentences.english: I can picture fainting, or having fainted, quite easily.
sentences.chinese: 我也能轻易能想象昏倒或者昏迷。

sentences.english: Suddenly, the old lady fainted down to the floor.
sentences.chinese: 突然，老妇人昏倒在了地上。

sentences.english: Jade home woke up and found wei macro self-assertion, were passed out again.
sentences.chinese: 玉家醒来，发现伟宏自作主张，被气得又再昏倒。

sentences.english: Her mother fainted,canting over from her chair onto the floor.
sentences.chinese: 她的母亲昏倒过去，从椅子上摔到地板上。

sentences.english: Lin Qianru learned from the newspaper that Jiao Zhixin had been executed.
sentences.chinese: 林倩如从报上得知焦志新被处决的消息当场昏倒。

definition: to faint/to swoon/to black out/to become unconscious
to lose consciousness/to be in a coma/stupor/coma/stunned/disoriented
to faint from fear/to be frightened into fits/shell-shocked
to collapse (from dehydration or loss of blood)/heat exhaustion
to be delirious/to be mentally confused
